comments.body: Note that we create symlinks to the standard `blas` and `lapack` library names before the build begins. The compilers are smart enough to follow them to their true location and thus are linked to `libopenblas` directly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +21,25 @@test -f "${PREFIX}/lib/libopenblas.a" && ln -fs "${PREFIX}/lib/libopenblas.a" "${PREFIX}/lib/liblapack.a"
test -f "${PREFIX}/lib/libopenblas.${DYLIB_EXT}" && ln -fs "${PREFIX}/lib/libopenblas.${DYLIB_EXT}" "${PREFIX}/lib/libblas.${DYLIB_EXT}"
test -f "${PREFIX}/lib/libopenblas.${DYLIB_EXT}" && ln -fs "${PREFIX}/lib/libopenblas.${DYLIB_EXT}" "${PREFIX}/lib/liblapack.${DYLIB_EXT}"

$PYTHON setup.py install

comments.body: We then clean them up after the build ends. This is done to ensure they don't get packaged. Plus it won't matter for anything built as they will already be linked against `libopenblas`.
